instruction: You are to plan something together. Only the situation is given to you; the details of the planning are up to you. Consider everything you need to take into account, contribute your ideas and suggestions, and respond to what is proposed to you.

questions.title: Planning a Cultural Event
questions.question: Develop a plan for a cultural meeting for young people between your hometowns and a German/Austrian/Swiss city. A sponsor has provided you with €4,000.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: So, we need to plan a cultural meeting for young people between our hometowns and a city in Germany, Austria, or Switzerland. We have 4,000 euros from the sponsor. First, we should select the city. What do you think, perhaps Berlin, because it is culturally diverse?

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Berlin sounds good, but maybe Vienna; it is closer to some hometowns and has great museums. The meeting should last two days, with workshops and excursions. How many participants are we planning for? Let's say 20 young people?

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: 20 sounds feasible. For the first day: arrival and a workshop on cultural exchange, e.g., about music or art. On the second day, a city tour and a farewell evening with dinner. Budget: 1,000 euros for accommodation, 1,000 for food, 1,000 for activities, and 1,000 for transport.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Good distribution. For accommodation: A hostel in Vienna costs approx. 50 euros per person per night, that fits. Activities: A visit to the Belvedere Museum and a concert. How do we advertise? Via social media and schools in our cities.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Yes, and topics: discussing cultural differences. To make it interactive, group work. What about food? Plan for vegetarian options. The budget seems sufficient; maybe we can save on transport with group tickets.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Perfect. Schedule: Friday arrival, Saturday program, Sunday departure. That gives us a solid plan.

questions.title: Planning a Student Exchange
questions.question: Develop a plan for a student exchange between your school and a partner school in a European country. You have €3,000 available for the organization.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: We are planning a student exchange with a school in France, let's say Paris. Duration: One week. 10 students from each side. Budget: 3,000 euros. First: activities like language courses and excursions.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: France is great for culture. Host families for accommodation to save costs. Program: Monday arrival and welcome party, Tuesday school visit, Wednesday trip to the Eiffel Tower. Budget: 1,000 for transport, 800 for food, 1,200 for activities.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Yes, and cultural workshops, e.g., learning to cook French food. Application: Interested students apply with a motivation letter. What about safety? Include insurance in the plan.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Good point. Teachers as chaperones. For the return exchange: A similar program in our city. This promotes language learning and friendships.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Exactly. Financially: Look for sponsors if more is needed. The budget is enough for the basics. Time: Next spring.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Agreed. The plan is well-rounded.

questions.title: Planning an Environmental Campaign
questions.question: Develop a plan for an environmental campaign in your city to reduce waste. A funding program provides you with €2,500.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Topic: Waste reduction in the city. Action: A cleanup day with workshops. Location: Central Park. Participants: 50 volunteers. Budget: 2,500 euros. First: Buy materials like gloves and bags.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Yes, and workshops on recycling. Duration: One Saturday. Program: Morning cleanup, afternoon lectures. Budget: 800 for material, 700 for advertising, 1,000 for catering and prizes.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Advertising via posters and social media. Cooperation with schools and clubs. Sustainability: Use info on using less plastic. What about the weather? Alternative plan indoors.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Right. Measuring success: Weight of the collected trash. That motivates. Budget fits, maybe sponsors for more.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Super. Goal: Raise awareness. Next step: Form a team for organization.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: The plan is actionable.

questions.title: Planning a Charity Event
questions.question: Develop a plan for a charity event to collect money for needy children. You have €5,000 seed capital from a donor.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Event: Benefit concert for children. Location: Local hall. Goal: Collect 10,000 euros. Budget: 5,000 euros. Invite bands, entrance fee 10 euros.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Good idea. Program: Music, raffle, food stalls. Duration: Four hours in the evening. Budget: 2,000 for bands, 1,000 for advertising, 1,500 for location, 500 for prizes.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Advertising: Flyers, online. Partners: Local companies for sponsorship. Security: Helpers for admission. What about donations? Show transparency.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Yes, a report at the end. For children: Play area. We will use the budget efficiently.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Agreed. Date: Next summer. Team: We organize.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Perfect plan.

questions.title: Planning a Sports Tournament
questions.question: Develop a plan for a sports tournament for amateurs in your region. A club gives you €3,500 for the execution.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Tournament: Football for amateurs. Location: Local sports field. Teams: 8. Budget: 3,500 euros. Prizes and referees.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Yes, one-day event. Program: Preliminary rounds, finals. Budget: 1,000 for prizes, 800 for referees, 1,000 for catering, 700 for advertising.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Registration online. Invite spectators, free entry. Weather plan: Indoor hall as backup. Inclusion: Mixed teams.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: Great. Sponsors for jerseys. Success: Emphasize fun and fair play.

exampleDialogue.speaker: A
exampleDialogue.text: Exactly. Date: Spring. The budget is sufficient.

exampleDialogue.speaker: B
exampleDialogue.text: The plan is ready.
